4.2.1.title: Kill Weight Mud (KWM)
4.2.1.content:
**Formula:**
```
KWM (ppg) = Current MW + (SIDPP ÷ 0.052 ÷ TVD)
```

**Where:**
- Current MW = mud weight in hole
- SIDPP = stabilized shut-in drillpipe pressure
- TVD = true vertical depth at bit

**Example:**
Current MW = 10.5 ppg
SIDPP = 520 psi
TVD = 10,000 ft

KWM = 10.5 + (520 ÷ 0.052 ÷ 10,000)
KWM = 10.5 + 1.0 = 11.5 ppg

**Note:** Always round UP to next 0.1 ppg for safety margin.

4.2.2.title: Initial Circulating Pressure (ICP)
4.2.2.content:
**Formula:**
```
ICP = SCR Pressure + SIDPP
```

**Where:**
- SCR = Slow Circulating Rate pressure at kill rate
- SIDPP = Shut-in drillpipe pressure

**Example:**
SCR at 30 spm = 650 psi
SIDPP = 520 psi

ICP = 650 + 520 = 1,170 psi

**Use:**
ICP is the drillpipe pressure at start of circulation during kill.

4.2.3.title: Final Circulating Pressure (FCP)
4.2.3.content:
**Formula:**
```
FCP = SCR × (KWM ÷ Current MW)
```

**Example:**
SCR = 650 psi
KWM = 11.5 ppg
Current MW = 10.5 ppg

FCP = 650 × (11.5 ÷ 10.5)
FCP = 650 × 1.095 = 712 psi

**Use:**
FCP is the drillpipe pressure when kill mud reaches the bit.

4.2.4.title: Drillpipe Pressure Schedule
4.2.4.content:
**For Wait & Weight Method:**

DP pressure decreases linearly from ICP to FCP as kill mud fills drillstring.

**Calculation:**
```
Pressure drop per stroke = (ICP - FCP) ÷ Strokes to bit
```

**Example:**
ICP = 1,170 psi
FCP = 712 psi
Strokes to bit = 1,000

Drop per stroke = (1,170 - 712) ÷ 1,000 = 0.458 psi/stroke

**Schedule:**
| Strokes | DP Pressure |
|---------|-------------|
| 0 | 1,170 |
| 200 | 1,078 |
| 400 | 987 |
| 600 | 895 |
| 800 | 804 |
| 1,000 | 712 |

**After Kill Mud at Bit:**
Maintain constant FCP until kill mud at surface.

4.2.5.title: Strokes Calculations
4.2.5.content:
**Volume Conversions:**
```
Strokes = Volume (bbl) ÷ Pump output (bbl/stk)
```

**Typical Pump Outputs:**
| Pump Type | Liner Size | Output |
|-----------|------------|--------|
| Triplex | 6" | 0.117 bbl/stk |
| Triplex | 6.5" | 0.136 bbl/stk |
| Triplex | 7" | 0.160 bbl/stk |

**Strokes to Bit:**
```
Strokes to bit = Drillstring volume (bbl) ÷ Pump output (bbl/stk)
```

**Total Kill Strokes:**
```
Total strokes = Total well volume (bbl) ÷ Pump output (bbl/stk)
```

4.2.6.title: MAASP (Maximum Allowable Annular Surface Pressure)
4.2.6.content:
**Formula:**
```
MAASP = (Shoe Fracture Gradient - MW) × 0.052 × Shoe TVD
```

**Or using LOT/FIT result:**
```
MAASP = (LOT EMW - Current MW) × 0.052 × Shoe TVD
```

**Example:**
LOT EMW = 14.5 ppg
Current MW = 12.0 ppg
Shoe TVD = 8,000 ft

MAASP = (14.5 - 12.0) × 0.052 × 8,000
MAASP = 2.5 × 0.052 × 8,000 = 1,040 psi

**Use:**
During kill, casing pressure must not exceed MAASP.

**Safety Factor:**
Typically apply 0.5 ppg safety factor to MAASP calculation.
